newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -T-bonds to remain positive above 110-12.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -T-bonds to remain positive above 110-12.

text.p: September T-bond futures will maintain their buoyant stance on Friday provided the contract can hold above 110-12, technical analysts said.

"T-bonds had a quiet, slightly reactive, day on Monday to the powerful day on Friday," said Adrian Sells, director at Crane Analysis in London. "We're still pretty positive on it as long as we don't start to get back below the 110-12 area, which is around 50 percent of the range on Friday."
Friday's contract range stretched from 109-15 to 111-09, after the market rallied sharply on the back of weak U.S. employment data.
At 0945 GMT, September T-bond futures were at 110-22 in automated trade, up 3/32 on the day.
Sells said while he did not envisage a deeper correction, a concerted break below 110-12 could take the contract down to below 110-00.
Donna Liu, technical analyst at DKB International in London, noted some initial support from a 38.2 percent Fibonacci retracement of Friday's range at 110-19.

"Yesterday the market closed just below the 200-day moving average at 110-19. This was a considerable negative but last Friday's volumes were so huge and open interest was up around 42,000 to 43,000 that...buying pressure will still remain," she said, adding that for the near term she remained positive on T-bonds.
To the upside, Sells said the contract would face an initial hurdle in the 111-08 area.
"It would have to break out of those 111-08, 09 highs we saw yesterday and on Friday in order to re-accelerate," he said.
Liu saw resistance at 111-11. That is the current level on a trendline drawn through the May 2 109-29 high, the May 13 109-12 high and the high on Friday.
Above there a further barrier is offered at 111-18, retracing part of the decline from mid-February to mid-April.
"That's a 76.4 percent retracement from 113-09 to 105-30," she said.
At the short end, September Eurodollars were at 94.030, unchanged on the day. December Eurodollars were quoted at 93.820, also unchanged.
